summary.p: A syllabary and a grammar of the Malayalam language.
It is not divided in numbered chapters, however nine sections can be identified on the basis of titles and arguments. They are listed below:

list.item: Regles Generalles pour les noms. Nouns are inflected into five declensions (pp. 1-11).
Pronoms, i.e. personnels, Qual, possessifs, demonstatifs, relatifs, interrogatifs, indefinis, responsifs –affirmatifs et negatifs (pp. 12-22).
Noms des nombre, i.e. cardinal, adverbe (pp. 23-28). This section also includes: Grand Livret de Multiplication (pp. 29-41); Quarré de Pythagore, en Chiffres Mallabars (p. 42).

Conjugaison des Verbs (pp. 49-91). Apart from moods and tenses (i.e. Indicatif, Subjonctif, Optatif, Infinitif, Gerundif, Participe, Conditionnel, Imperative, Supin, présent, imparfait, preterit parfait, passé eloigné, anterieur, plus que parfait, futuro, passé avenir), this section also includes Verbe Personnel, Verbs Effectifs et mandatifs, Verbs deffectifs affirmatif and negatifs, Particule qui rendent les verbes affirmatifs negatifs, Verbs de l'Elegance Mallabarre. The section on verbs and with Maniere d'use des Verbs, et quand on doit s'en servir (pp. 92-96).
Propositions (i.e. de lieu, de temp, de maniere, qui governent le Genitif, le Datif, l'accusatif, etc.) (pp. 96-102).
Syntaxe ou maniere de connoitre toutes les parties d'un discour (pp. 105-114).

origin.origDate: No internal date. Vinson, who catalogued it as MS.IND.17 Rudiment de la langue Malabar described it in 1902 saying that it probably dates back to the beginning of the 19th century (in Petit 2014: 450). The proposed span of time is calculated on the basis of the permanence of Bernard François Bertrand Picot marquis de la Motte (1734-1797) in India. Indeed, he reached the Malabar Coast in 1750 and he was named General Commander of the Malabar Coast and Governor of Mahé in 1751. He returned in France in 1782 (Courcelle 1823: 370-371). The linguistic feature of the variety of the Portuguese language used in the manuscript would allow to date it earlier, at the first half of the 17th century.
